Where can I apply for a student ID card, credit book, academic debts, application for changing the direction of training, form of education, name, passport data, expulsion, discount on training, installment, refusal to study elective disciplines, etc.?
In the unified dean's office - 308 office.
Where can I get my student ID or resolve academic document issues?
In the unified dean's office - 308 office.
Who handles student ID card requests and academic document changes?
In the unified dean's office - 308 office.
What should I do if my faculty is not available on inai.kg to apply for a social card?

On the basis of enrollment orders, the university enters information into the register of students. In the first two weeks of September. Then you can order it.
If you have problems with registration, you should come to 308 office to Dononbaeva Anna Alexandrovna. She will help you fill out the form and put it in the register.

If you have problems with registration, you should come to 308 office to Dononbaeva Anna Alexandrovna. She will help you fill out the form and put it in the register.

Where can I order a certificate of training/characteristics, a certificate-call, a certificate for the military enlistment office?

Certificate of education/characteristics
Via LC, in the “Documents” section
In person at specialists
Call-up certificate
Via LC, in the “Documents” section
Certificate for the military registration and enlistment office Appendix No. 2 to the List (item 3)
In person at the military registration and enlistment office (office 312).
What is a call-out certificate?

Part-time education in the implementation of the labor code 171 and 173 articles provides for study leave for those who combine study with work.
For part-time students, these are periods of accrual, a week from September 28, and winter and summer periods of 2-3 weeks.
Part-time students are entitled to such leave only during interim certification, winter and summer sessions.
You order a certificate-call, and your employer will have to provide you with paid study leave for this period.
In order to order a certificate-call, you need to write to the dean's office mail your full name, direction of training and the name of the organization.
If I haven't turned in my 086/u form and photos for my student ID card yet, when can I bring them?

You need to bring 2 3x4 photos to room 308. Students in the Listener Program also need to bring photos for their ID card. Weekdays from 10am to 6pm. A 086/u certificate is not needed for part-time and full-time students.
Is it possible to write an application for transfer to another group in the same direction?
Yes, you can, only if you find a person in the group where you want to transfer who will agree to change places with you. The two of you must submit an application to the Integrated Dean's Office.
Can students park in the parking lot?
There is no parking available for students.
Are INAI students eligible for military deferment?
Yes, deferment is available. But only for full-time students who take deferment for the first time.
Does the university have a hostel? How to get in it?
The university has a dormitory, for this you only need to be a visiting student and provide a certificate of residence
Where can I get advice on tuition fees?
Advice on payment issues can be obtained from the financial department of the University.
How can I find out the details for payment?
Advice on payment issues can be obtained from the financial department of the University.

To change your data, go to the nearest PCS with your passport and fill out a data change application.

To change your data, go to the nearest PCS with your passport and fill out a data change application.

What is the procedure to obtain a scholarship?
To receive a scholarship, you must achieve a high score on the state exam (ORT) and submit your application to the scholarship department.
How can I qualify for a government scholarship?
To receive a scholarship, you must achieve a high score on the state exam (ORT) and submit your application to the scholarship department.
What are the requirements for receiving a scholarship?
To receive a scholarship, you must achieve a high score on the state exam (ORT) and submit your application to the scholarship department.
How do I apply for a library membership?
Library membership can be obtained by visiting the library with your student ID card and filling out a membership form.
What is needed to register for the library?
Library membership can be obtained by visiting the library with your student ID card and filling out a membership form.
Where can I register for access to library resources?
Library membership can be obtained by visiting the library with your student ID card and filling out a membership form.
How to change my academic advisor?
To change your academic advisor, you need to submit a formal request to the dean's office stating the reason for the change.
What is the process to switch academic advisors?
To change your academic advisor, you need to submit a formal request to the dean's office stating the reason for the change.
Can I request a new academic advisor?
To change your academic advisor, you need to submit a formal request to the dean's office stating the reason for the change.
How do I appeal a grade I received?
Grade appeals can be filed by submitting a formal application to the examination committee within two weeks of the grade being published.
What is the process for contesting a grade?
Grade appeals can be filed by submitting a formal application to the examination committee within two weeks of the grade being published.
Where do I submit a grade appeal?
Grade appeals can be filed by submitting a formal application to the examination committee within two weeks of the grade being published.
What documents are needed to transfer to another university?
To transfer to another university, you will need a transcript of records, an application for transfer, and any other documents required by the receiving institution.
How can I transfer to a different university?
To transfer to another university, you will need a transcript of records, an application for transfer, and any other documents required by the receiving institution.
What is the procedure for transferring universities?
To transfer to another university, you will need a transcript of records, an application for transfer, and any other documents required by the receiving institution.
How do I request a duplicate diploma?
Duplicate diplomas can be requested at the registrar's office by filling out a formal application and providing identification.
What steps are needed to obtain a duplicate diploma?
Duplicate diplomas can be requested at the registrar's office by filling out a formal application and providing identification.
Where can I apply for a diploma replacement?
Duplicate diplomas can be requested at the registrar's office by filling out a formal application and providing identification.
How to apply for admission to the institute?
To apply to the institute, complete the application process on the official website or contact the admissions office.
How much does the contract cost?
The cost of the contract is 100,000 som.
Does the institute accept foreign students?
Yes, the institute accepts foreign students.
Does the institute accept international students?
Yes, the institute accepts foreign students.
Are there any benefits for disabled people or single mothers?
No, there are no benefits for disabled people or single mothers.
Is there a correspondence course available?
No, the institute does not offer a correspondence course.
is it possible to study by correspondence?
No, the institute does not offer a correspondence course.
can I Get A correspondence classes?
No, the institute does not offer a correspondence course.
What faculties does the institute offer?
The institute offers the following faculties: Program Technologies (AIN), Web Informatics (WIN), and Applied Data Analysis (DIN).
Does the institute have a canteen?
No, the institute does not have a canteen.
are there any clubs at INAI?
Yes, there is a club for those who organize events, a club for those who promote the university and a club for charity work
What documents are required for admission?

Documents required for admission:

- Certificate of ORT (minimum score 110)
- High school diploma
- 2 copies of passport
- 6 photos (3x4) with full name on the back
- Conscription certificate (original or copy)
Study: Are classes going to use physical journals?
No, electronic only.
Will attendance and grades be tracked in paper or electronically?
No, electronic only.
Will paper journals be used?
No, electronic only.
Can class notes be kept on a laptop?
Yes, of course.
Is it allowed to use laptops for class notes?
Yes, of course.
Can students take notes digitally during lectures?
Yes, of course.
Is the time of the first class always the same?
The first pair starts at 9:00, but the actual pairings will be according to your schedule.
What is the maximum number of absences allowed?
No more than a third of the total number of classes.
How many absences are permitted without penalty?
No more than a third of the total number of classes.
What is the attendance requirement for students?
No more than a third of the total number of classes.
What happens if I miss a class?
The process of making up missed classes is negotiated individually with the teacher.
What should I do if I miss a class?
The process of making up missed classes is negotiated individually with the teacher.
What is the English language placement process?
In all courses except Linguistics, students take a language proficiency test. Based on the results, you are assigned to groups according to your language level.
When and where do I apply for a change of English language group?
You can transfer to another group if you have no language debts, if there is a good reason to transfer, and if there is a free place in another group.
I am not showing up in my foreign language teacher's journal, what should I do?

Write your name to the e-mail: a.saprykina@inai.kg.
Methodists will correct everything.
Is it possible to switch to another form of study after the first year?
It is possible.
Where can I see my attendance?
You can view your attendance in the student's personal profile, under Help, then Logs.
How to apply for retaking the exam?
You can apply for retake in your personal cabinet through the “Documents” section.
Can I apply for retake online?
You can apply for retake in your personal cabinet through the “Documents” section.
When and where can I change my supervisor?
Apply to the Dean's Office, indicating the reason for the change and prior approval of the new supervisor.
How do I transfer to a different supervisor?
Apply to the Dean's Office, indicating the reason for the change and prior approval of the new supervisor.

Yes, of course.

Exams: How can I find out the duration of the session and semester?
Where are the start and end dates for the semester listed?
In your personal cabinet there is a section “Class dates” where you can find the dates of session, semester and vacations. According to these dates you can use them to pay tuition fees
